clinical_study.official_title: Phase II Trial of Metformin for Pulmonary Hypertension in Heart Failure With Preserved Ejection Fraction

brief_summary.textblock: The main objective of this study is to determine the clinical efficacy of metformin versus placebo and the therapeutic response with regards to functional capacity and hemodynamics in PH-HFpEF.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a 12-week blinded cross over trial of metformin in PH-HFpEF to improve exercise hemodynamics, functional capacity, and glucose metabolism. This phase II clinical trial will provide detailed phenotyping, physiological and mechanistic data on PH-HFpEF.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: The primary endpoint of the trial will be mean pulmonary artery pressure (mPAP) during submaximal exercise as compared between placebo and metformin at 12 weeks (i.e. the week 12 RHC of placebo vs week 12 RHC of metformin).
primary_outcome.time_frame: 12 weeks (i.e. the 12th week of placebo vs 12th week of metformin)

arm_group.description: 500mg PO (by mouth) BID (two times daily) x 1 week then increase to 1000mg PO BID x 11 weeks
Placebo capsule that is of identical size, shape, and color to experimental drug capsule PO (by mouth) BID (two times each day) for 12 weeks
